channel.title: Alchemist Changes
channel.description:
Currently, Alchemists are kind of a waste, always instant execution.
1 make them unique in game like hunter. 2 make them heal nightshade 3 make their heal limited use, maybe 3? 4 change night poison to 1 from 2 5 add ability to instant kill someone if you are being executed, like hunter’s ability except you can pick target.
Would solve main issue (alchs are insta exes) - threat of getting killed if you are the instigator + actually useful in unseen games.
Falsely claiming alch would be much higher risk-reward, compared to now.

item.title: Alchemist Changes
item.dc:creator: markio16
item.description:
So there are a couple of problems that compound on each other into the current state of alchemist

First is that BlueDragon has no reason to keep a neutral alive, most of the neutral classes are at worst actively killing BlueDragon targets, and at best maybe a BlueDragon unit gets healed of poison. Maybe.

The only real punishment for ruthlessly executing neutrals is that executing a fool buys killers more time, but execution via the prince bypasses altogether, so just let the prince do it.

Ideally you would have games in which it’s viable for the prince to claim neutral to avoid getting attacked by evil/neutral killers.

Second is that claiming to be an alchemist is a sort of “newbie trap”. Alchemist is a “harmless” role to claim for newer possessors, reapers, and unseen/cult alike which more often than not means that people whom claim alchemist not aware of the fact that that BlueDragon has no reason to keep neutrals alive.

It therefore, never reaches the second stage of mind-games in which only a fool would claim alchemist and everyone here knows not to claim alchemist so let’s not waste our 2-3 precious execution days on that guy.

item.title: Alchemist Changes
item.dc:creator: O_O
item.description:
Why would ability to kill make it a fool class? The objective is to survive not to get executed. I’m trying to suggest how to get rid of the stupid “I’m alch” claims that get insta execution. Nobody thinks twice about executing an alch. With this change, people would kill them at night instead. Reapers and possessors wouldn’t die in a night kill…

Limiting # of heals counters the nightshade buff in their power. But makes class useless to BD after they’re spent. Harder to survive once you’re useless.

Very surprised at a 28% win rate. Has that changed over time? I’ve been playing for a couple weeks now and alch wins are extremely rare in games I’ve been in, so much so my friends and I all discussed it.

Do alch wins decrease as players gain experience? Would be interesting to know how class win % changes by experience. In matches with higher experienced players, do alchs have same win percentage? Is it artificially high because the game is ina growth phase and new players are artificially boosting it?

Read full topic

item.title: Alchemist Changes
item.dc:creator: Luxx
item.description:
O_O:

1 make them unique in game like hunter.

There’s no good reason for Alchemist to be Uniqe.

O_O:

2 make them heal nightshade

There’s a reason Alchemist is unable to heal nightshade, it’s so it won’t be as strong as Physician, therefore not a neutral replacement for Phys.

O_O:

3 make their heal limited use, maybe 3?

4 change night poison to 1 from 2

These 2 changes alone are gonna make Alchemist even more useless and more of a waste.
Limiting their healing powers is not necessary. They already have limited healing abilites due to their inability to heal Nightshade.
No good reason to decrease their attacks either.

O_O:

5 add ability to instant kill someone if you are being executed, like hunter’s ability except you can pick target.

Then Alchemist would just be a new Fool then, but with killing possibilites.
So no…

And as Tryph said… Alchemist’s win rate is good. In my opinion, it’s one of the most well balanced classes in this game. No need for change.
